title: Johanna Konta brings season to an early end due to a longstanding knee injury
text:
Johanna Konta has brought her season to a premature end because of a knee injury.

The British number one has not played since losing to Elina Svitolina in the US Open quarter-finals in early September.

Her latest withdrawal is from the Elite Trophy in Zhuhai next week, a second-tier end-of-season event for those top-20 players who missed out on a spot at the WTA Finals.

Jo Konta attended the launch of the Esquire Townhouse in south-west London on Wednesday

Konta's run at the US Open in New York was curtailed by Elina Svitolina in the quarter-finals

JOHANNA KONTA AT 2019 GRAND SLAMS Australian Open: 2nd round French Open: Semi-finals Wimbledon: Quarter-finals US Open: Quarter-finals

It is a disappointing end to a brilliant season for Konta, who began the year ranked 39 and is currently sitting 11th in the WTA rankings.

Her highlights include reaching the last eight at both the US Open and Wimbledon and playing her third grand slam semi-final at the French Open.

Konta's development on clay was the biggest surprise, with the 28-year-old also reaching the final of the Italian Open in Rome on what had previously been by some way her weakest surface.

She will hope to pick up where she left off by pushing into the top 10 next season, towards her career-high of four in the world.

All her focus now will turn towards rehab and recovery in the off-season, ahead of the Australian Open starting on January 20.
description: Konta has not played since losing in the US Open quarter-finals in early September - it is a disappointing end to a brilliant year, who began the year ranked 39 and is currently sitting 11th.
